awd_titl_txt: Structure and Function of Proline Permease
awd_abstract_narration: An important aspect of cell growth--how necessary nutrients get                 into the cell (transport)--is poorly understood in terms of ther                actual molecular mechanisms of transport and the proteins                       responsible for it.  The proline transport mutants of Salmonella                will be used for studies of the molecular mechanism of sodium-                  driven transport.  By selection for particular classes of mutants,              domains of the protease involved in substrate binding and                       translocation will be identified; with the aid of site directed                 mutagenesis of the implicated residues it whould be possible to                 test the predicted roles of certain amino acids and come to                     understand, with the aid of biochemical and biophysical approaches,             the conformational changes necessary for substrate translocation.               Elucidation of the structure-function relationships of ion-driven               transport proteins should result from such examinations.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
